intro: Erodium ciconium f. brevicaule, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Geraniaceae family. It is a low-growing annual herb characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of pink or purple flowers. The plant typically thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in grassy areas, along roadsides, and in cultivated fields. Its flowers bloom in early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is native to Europe and has been introduced to other regions, where it can become a weed in agricultural settings.
